name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

name: Full Moon Rituals - Sound Healing & Journalling
description: The full moon is a sacred moment to pause, slow down, and look within. It’s a time to reflect, let go of what no longer serves you, and notice what has come to light. By letting go, you make space for new energy, new intentions, and new possibilities. A time for release, gratitude, and gentle closure.In this gently guided session, we’ll move through:✨ Breathwork – To ground yourself and create space within.📝 Reflection & Journaling – To process your thoughts and emotions with clarity.🌕 Letting Go Ritual – To lovingly release what’s holding you back and make space for new possibilities.🎶 Sound Healing – To soothe the nervous system and release stagnant energy.Together, we’ll create a space for deep connection with yourself, your intentions, and the energy of new beginnings. Come as you are, and allow yourself to soften into this moment of self-care and renewal.About the FacilitatorSneha a sound healer, mindfulness guide, and someone who’s walked the path from burnout to inner clarity. After years in the corporate world as a CA, I made an intentional shift, from spreadsheets to sound bowls, from deadlines to deep presence. Life gave me the courage to tune into my inner wisdom, and that led me here- to the path of healing, mindfulness, and holding space for othersToday, I blend sound healing, mindfulness and psychology to help people feel more grounded, present, and connected to themselves. My work is heart-led, real, and rooted in everything I have experienced & learnt along the way.

name: Blueprint of Burden: Screening An Engineered Dream
description: A screening of "An Engineered Dream"Followed by a Q&A with director Hemant GabaStep into the high-pressure world of Kota, where over a hundred thousand students arrive each year chasing dreams not always their own. An Engineered Dream is a powerful documentary exploring how societal and parental expectations shape — and sometimes shatter — the futures of India's youth.This eye-opening film examines the intense culture of coaching institutes and the emotional toll it takes, set against the backdrop of their lives and dreams.🗣️ Stay after the screening for a live conversation with director Hemant Gaba, followed by an audience Q&A.

description: ​In a world of quick replies and seen ticks, this is a return to something slower, simpler, and more human.​Join us for a casual coffee meetup where we’ll write handwritten letters—not to friends you already know, but to strangers across the table. Through gentle prompts, you’ll write from the heart: reflections, questions, memories, or a moment captured in ink.✨ What to Expect:​📝 Prompts, not pressure. You’ll be gently guided to write.📓 Paper, Pen & Presence. We’re keeping it analogue—no digital devices.☕ Coffee & quiet company. A warm cup to keep you grounded as you write.

name: Anime Pop-Up @ Bento Bento
description: Bento Bento Presents: An Anime-Inspired Culinary Experience14th & 15th June | 12:30–3:00 PM, 7:00–10:00 PMBento Bento is back with a new celebration of food and fandom — this time diving into the vibrant and flavourful world of anime.Inspired by iconic scenes and comfort meals from some of Japan’s most beloved anime series, this curated pop-up brings to life dishes that fans have seen on screen and long wondered about. With past tributes to Studio Ghibli and Midnight Diner, Bento Bento now takes a fresh turn towards the fast-paced, heartfelt, and imaginative food culture of anime.Chef Anumitra, whose culinary roots are shaped in part by her time in Japan, brings a deep respect for authenticity while channeling the visual flair and nostalgia that these shows evoke. Whether you’re a long-time anime fan or a curious food lover, Bento Bento invites you to taste the flavours of your favourite shows.Come hungry. Leave nostalgic. THE MENUSweets & SnacksDorayaki – Doraemon Soft, fluffy pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste. This is Doraemon’s favorite snack — a simple, sweet treat with a hint of nostalgia.Dango – Naruto Chewy rice dumplings on skewers, glazed with sweet soy sauce. Often eaten during festivals, dango is a symbol of joy and camaraderie.Savoury DishesOnigiri (Single) – Demon Slayer Triangular rice balls wrapped in seaweed and filled with surprises like tangy pickled plum or seasoned vegetables — a staple in bento boxes and beloved by anime heroes on the go.Gyoza – Food Wars Pan-seared Japanese dumplings with a juicy, seasoned filling. These dumplings are ubiquitous in Food Wars' competitions, and here they’re served crisp with a dipping sauce.Nikuman – Haikyuu!! Fluffy steamed buns filled with savoury pork. This hearty snack is a popular reward after volleyball practice scenes in Haikyuu!!, and perfect for a quick burst of energy.MealsRamen – Naruto A steaming bowl of noodles in rich broth, topped with marinated egg, pork, and greens. This dish is practically a co-star in Naruto, where Ichiraku Ramen is a frequent backdrop.Katsudon – Yuri on Ice, My Hero Academia A comforting bowl of rice topped with crispy pork cutlet, soft scrambled egg, and sweet-salty sauce. Katsudon is often portrayed as a dish of encouragement and reward in anime.Chicken Karaage Bento Juicy, marinated fried chicken served with rice and pickles — this Japanese-style fried chicken bento is crunchy, satisfying, and a lunchbox favorite.Brinjal with Ponzu Bento A vegetarian bento featuring grilled or roasted brinjal dressed in a tangy ponzu sauce. Balanced, light, and packed with umami.Vegetarian variations are available upon request.

location.name: Bento Bento
location.address: Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: Anime Pop-Up @ Bento Bento
description: Bento Bento Presents: An Anime-Inspired Culinary Experience14th & 15th June | 12:30–3:00 PM, 7:00–10:00 PMBento Bento is back with a new celebration of food and fandom — this time diving into the vibrant and flavourful world of anime.Inspired by iconic scenes and comfort meals from some of Japan’s most beloved anime series, this curated pop-up brings to life dishes that fans have seen on screen and long wondered about. With past tributes to Studio Ghibli and Midnight Diner, Bento Bento now takes a fresh turn towards the fast-paced, heartfelt, and imaginative food culture of anime.Chef Anumitra, whose culinary roots are shaped in part by her time in Japan, brings a deep respect for authenticity while channeling the visual flair and nostalgia that these shows evoke. Whether you’re a long-time anime fan or a curious food lover, Bento Bento invites you to taste the flavours of your favourite shows.Come hungry. Leave nostalgic. THE MENUSweets & SnacksDorayaki – Doraemon Soft, fluffy pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste. This is Doraemon’s favorite snack — a simple, sweet treat with a hint of nostalgia.Dango – Naruto Chewy rice dumplings on skewers, glazed with sweet soy sauce. Often eaten during festivals, dango is a symbol of joy and camaraderie.Savoury DishesOnigiri (Single) – Demon Slayer Triangular rice balls wrapped in seaweed and filled with surprises like tangy pickled plum or seasoned vegetables — a staple in bento boxes and beloved by anime heroes on the go.Gyoza – Food Wars Pan-seared Japanese dumplings with a juicy, seasoned filling. These dumplings are ubiquitous in Food Wars' competitions, and here they’re served crisp with a dipping sauce.Nikuman – Haikyuu!! Fluffy steamed buns filled with savoury pork. This hearty snack is a popular reward after volleyball practice scenes in Haikyuu!!, and perfect for a quick burst of energy.MealsRamen – Naruto A steaming bowl of noodles in rich broth, topped with marinated egg, pork, and greens. This dish is practically a co-star in Naruto, where Ichiraku Ramen is a frequent backdrop.Katsudon – Yuri on Ice, My Hero Academia A comforting bowl of rice topped with crispy pork cutlet, soft scrambled egg, and sweet-salty sauce. Katsudon is often portrayed as a dish of encouragement and reward in anime.Chicken Karaage Bento Juicy, marinated fried chicken served with rice and pickles — this Japanese-style fried chicken bento is crunchy, satisfying, and a lunchbox favorite.Brinjal with Ponzu Bento A vegetarian bento featuring grilled or roasted brinjal dressed in a tangy ponzu sauce. Balanced, light, and packed with umami.Vegetarian variations are available upon request.

name: Sarangi Recital with Ustaad Dilshad Khan | Baithak
description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistUstaad Dilshad Khan is a tenth-generation Sarangi player from the renowned Sikar Gharana of Rajasthan. Trained under his grandfather, father, and later the legendary Ustad Sultan Khan Sahab, Dilshad has emerged as one of the foremost torchbearers of the Sarangi today.A celebrated soloist and collaborator, he has performed globally with maestros like Ustad Zakir Hussain and Pt. Birju Maharaj, and his music features in over 500 Bollywood films including Devdas and Dangal. He is also a recipient of the prestigious Aga Khan Music Award (2022).With deep roots in tradition and a global reach, Dilshad Khan brings the timeless voice of the Sarangi to a new generation of listeners.This event is supported by Samagata Foundation.Terms and Conditions1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.5. Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.8. In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Needle Paw - An Intimate Listening
description: Experience Needle Paw by Nai Palm like never before. Join Deep Notes and Ram’s Musique Experience for an intimate listening session, co-hosted by Harini Iyer (Tamil Jazz Collective, Chennai) and Goutham Iyengar.Needle Paw is a raw, acoustic album that showcases Nai Palm’s extraordinary voice and storytelling. We’ll explore the album’s inspirations, its unique recording process, and the emotional landscapes it traverses. Whether you’re a longtime fan or new to Nai Palm’s music, this session promises a night of discovery, conversation, and connection. Date: June 6th, 2025 Time: 7:00 PM Venue: Ram’s Musique Experience, MG Road, Bangalore Limited seats. Book now!

name: Leela by Sanjay Divecha (Live) at Sabha BLR
description: Sanjay Divecha is one of the most revered guitar players in India. A unique and compelling voice as a player and composer, he is part of the hugely successful supergroup Cross Currents led by Zakir Hussain and featuring stalwarts such as Dave Holland, Vinnie Colaiuta, Chris Potter, Eddie Daniels, Shankar Mahadevan and Louiz Banks. Through a luminous 35 year long career, Sanjay has worked with artists such as Angelique Kidjo, Carlos Santana, Michael McDonald, Fred Raulston, Dave Weckl, Louis Johnson, Dumazz and Sambaguru among others.He also collaborated with A.R. Rahman on the Danny Boyle movie “127 Hours” that won ‘Best Original Score’, the OST for the movie “Woman on Top” with Argentinian composer Luis Bacalov, Sanjay also scored for the movie ‘Leela’ by Somnath Sen which won a Special Jury Award at Toronto Reel World Film Festival.An alumnus (1989) from Musician’s Institute (M.I) in Los Angeles, Sanjay continues to mentor and develop musicians all over the country. His students are not only guitar players, but composers, musicians and singers of all disciplines. Sanjay teaches private lessons and holds workshops to develop musicality and a well rounded aesthetic sensibility in musicians. Sanjay Divecha on the music of 'Leela' :As a human being on this planet I’ve always believed in the Oneness of all things in this universe. Going through life's bylanes and observing how events unfold and teach you the lessons to be learned, this belief of Oneness has only strengthened with time. My work as an artist has primarily been to connect with my inner self, and express from a place of honesty. The yearning to learn something new in my art and refine my skill set has been my constant companion. After having written and performed music with various ensembles, I finally mustered up the courage to record a collection of music which was mainly written for solo guitar, and also mainly recorded on acoustic guitar. These songs are reflections of some of my journeys and inspirations, interpreted in a spontaneous and instinctive manner. The title 'Leela' refers to the divine Leela - joyous and playful - yet a profound act of creation. As I started the recording process I started to add a few layers to enhance the music and some guest artists came on board to complete the experience which was truly fulfilling for me as an artist. The organic nature of this work takes me back to my formative years as a guitar player and I’m grateful to be sharing this work and for it to take its own journey.

name: Where You From: A Theatrical Poetry Performance
description: So tell me, where are you from, now that you're here? Are you from earth's kernels, or a childhood lane? Are you from a summer of love, or your innate politics? Are you from where they say you're from, or have you yet to find out?Where You From?This genre-defining show offers glimpses into the changing identities of a body in continued performance. Bringing cliff notes from a decade-long practice in creating works of words, Nupur Azadi - a slam poet emerged from Singapore - shows what is possible when meditations in movement, voicework, spoken word, and theatrical traditions come together.65-minute, devised-solo told in fours acts, without intermission.Multi-disciplinary and multi-media show suitable for audiences 16+.This show is part of A Decade of Theatrical Poetry celebration and was first shown during BLR Hubba, December 2024.

name: MyBoTree Circle - Aromatics in Daily Life
description: Aromatics in Daily Life: Enhancing Well-Being through Essential Oils and Natural ScentsDiscover the power of nature’s fragrances in supporting holistic wellness. This introductory experience explores aromatherapy—the use of pure essential oils and natural aromatic substances—to nurture the body, calm the mind, and uplift the spirit.Join us as we delve into the world of natural scents and their potential to complement other wellness practices. Together, we’ll explore how aromatics can be integrated into everyday routines to address common lifestyle concerns such as:Pain and tension reliefImproved sleep qualityAnxiety and stress managementHormonal balanceEmotional grounding and clarityParticipants will also have a unique opportunity to engage their olfactory senses at our Aroma Station, where you can experience first-hand the therapeutic qualities of the essential oils and aromatic botanicals we discuss.Whether you're new to aromatherapy or curious to expand your self-care toolkit, this session offers a gentle and informative gateway into the restorative world of natural scents.
